message: Professor V N Achutha Naikan from Subir Chowdhury School of Quality and Reliability assumed charge as the Dean, Vinod Gupta School of Management on July 22, 2021 for a period of 1 year.  Prof. Naikan received his B.Tech degree in Mechanical Engineering from University of Kerala (1988), M.Tech degree in Reliability Engineering (1990) and Ph.D degree in Industrial Engineering and Management (1996) from Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur and joined the Institute as faculty member in 1996.  His research areas of interest are Condition Based Maintenance, Quality Control & Management, Simulation, Reliability Engineering and Life Testing.  Heartiest Congratulations to Prof. Naikan!!!

It gives us immense pleasure to announce that Wiley has published a book entitled “Chemical Reactivity in Confined Systems: Theory, Modelling and Applications", edited by Professor Pratim Kumar Chattaraj  from the Department of Chemistry of IIT Kharagpur along with his student, Dr. Debdutta Chakraborty.   To get to know in detail about the book, please click on https://www.wiley.com/en-af/Chemical+Reactivity+in+Confined+Systems%3A+Theory,+Modelling+and+Applications-p-9781119684022  Hearty Congratulations to Prof. Chattaraj and Dr Chakraborty!

IIT KGP Student Team EcoDabba”- Runners up in the 2021 New Venture Championship    A big congratulations to the students from the Department of Chemical Engineering, Rajat Maheshwari (graduating in 2021), Sourav Kundu (graduated in 2020), Bindu Sancheti (graduated in 2020) as well as Nikita Agrawal (graduated in 2020) from the Department of Agricultural and Food Engineering of  IIT Kharagpur, their start up named, “ EcoDabba Packaging Products LLP” secured the position of Second Runners- up at the Bank of America Sustainability Round in the 2021 New Venture Championship (NVC), organised by the Lundquist College of Business, the University of Oregon. As the runners-up, each student of the team was awarded with a cash prize of $1,000.   Under the supervision of Prof Abhijeet Chandra, assistant professor of Finance and Accounting of Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur, the students’ team proposed a novel idea of packaging food in bagasse (sugarcane waste) coated with an eco- coating for increased longevity which is completely biodegradable food storage packaging. The solution proposed by EcoDabba quickly biodegrades replenishing the soil and creating value for farmers. The IIT Kharagpur team was the only team from India to be among the semi-finalists teams in the NVC 2021.

Initiation of 1st Chair Professorship in the Department of Electronics & Electrical Communication Engineering  IIT Kharagpur has established the “Prithviraj Banerjee and Swati Banerjee Chair Professorship” with an endowment of $ 81,082, received from its eminent and distinguished alumnus, Dr. Prithviraj “Prith” Banerjee (1981/B.Tech./E&ECE/Azad).   In this regards, virtual signing ceremony of Memorandum of Understanding between IIT Kharagpur and Dr Prithviraj Banerjee was arranged on July 02, 2021, where Prof Virendra Kumar Tewari, the Director of IIT Kharagpur and Dr Prith Banerjee, the Chief Technology Officer of ANSYS had signed the MoU in the presence of Prof Amit Patra, the Deputy Director; Prof Jayanta Mukhopadhyay, the Dean Outreach; Prof Surjya Kanta Pal, the Associate Dean of Office of Alumni Affairs and Branding; Prof Anandaroop Bhattacharya, Associate Dean of International Relations and Ranking and Prof Mrityunjoy Chakraborty, the Head of the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering (E&ECE), IIT Kharagpur.

Pledge for Green has not gone unseen  Planting trees is recognized as one of the most engaging, environment friendly activities. Since its foundation in 1951, IIT Kharagpur has embarked on a journey to protect the environment and spread the awareness of conserving forest through various activities. During a short detour around the campus, one could enlighten the mind and soothe the eyes with a stunning visual of wider varieties of trees. To create links between a healthy environment and healthy livelihoods, IIT campus dwellers have opted for organic farming and planting trees in free spaces to adhere to the outcry of growing green. Our students and staff contribute immensely to increasing the green cover. The departments have also been planting trees in the hall of residence. The staff and students are highly passionate about taking care of the campus greenery.

IIT Kharagpur unveiled the increasing ozone pollution in Antarctica  IIT Kharagpur researchers Prof Jayanarayanan Kuttippurath and the research scholar Mr. Pankaj Kumar from the Centre of Oceans, Rivers, Atmosphere and Land Science revealed significant increase of ozone pollution in the Antarctic troposphere for the past 25 years, which is a concern as the region is far from the industries and continental emission sources.   The increasing pollution in a remote region with no industries, no significant population, very limited anthropogenic activities and about 6500 km away from the equator, is a serious concern and suggests substantial anthropogenic pollution across the latitudes.  Dominant sources of ozone are both natural and from human-related sources. The researchers compiled the ozone data measured between 1992 and 2018 at ground level and through the atmosphere, from the lower atmosphere into the ozone layer, at eight stations across Antarctica.   For more details click the link: https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-unveiled-the-increasing-ozone-pollution-in-antarctica/

Indigenous development of PSA technology based medical grade oxygen plant  In IIT Kharagpur’s assistance, Nektor Health Science System, Ahmedabad has developed an indigenous prototype plant for generation of medical grade oxygen.  Globally, the shortage of medical oxygen has become a major challenge for treating COVID-19 patients. Considering the fact, in corroboration to IIT Kharagpur researcher, the highly experienced team of Nektor Health Science System, Ahmedabad, has developed an indigenous Pressure Swing Adsorption (PSA) oxygen manufacturing plant with required purity and pressure.   For more details click the link: https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/indigenous-development-of-psa-technology-based-medical-grade-oxygen-plant/

Celebration of Van Mahotsav at IIT Kharagpur  Van Mahotsav is both warning and an urge to mankind to protect forests, plant trees and avoid the future from turning into deserts. In an endeavor towards maintaining the green campus as well as to spread awareness of planting more and more trees and protecting the environment, Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur has celebrated Van Mahotsav on July 07, 2021.    To commemorate the occasion, the Director, the Deputy Director, the Dean Outreach, the Associate Dean Outreach and the Associate Dean of Alumni Affairs and Branding of IIT Kharagpur along with other staffs and faculty members have planted the saplings of Bakul Tree (Mimusops elengi) – for the fact that it is an evergreen and a medicinal plant as well as it provides the dense shade, at the campus and the pledge has been taken to take care of the saplings planted throughout the year.

IIT Kharagpur developed algorithm for summarizing legal court case documents  The Assistant Professor and the Research Scholars from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Prof Saptarshi Ghosh, Paheli Bhattacharya and Soham Poddar in collaboration with Koustav Rudra (IITKGP CSE alumnus; presently at Leibniz University) and Kripabandhu Ghosh (IISER Kolkata) have developed an unsupervised algorithm for summarizing legal court case documents. In this regards, their research paper entitled Incorporating Domain Knowledge for Extractive Summarization of Legal Case Documents has been honoured with “Donald Berman Award” for the Best Student Paper at the most prestigious conference in AI- Law, the “International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Law (ICAIL) 2021”.   Congratulations!!!

Professor Amit Patra, Department of Electrical Engineering  assumed the charge as Deputy Director of the Institute on 30th June, 2021.   Prof. Amit Patra received the B.Tech., M.Tech. and Ph.D. degrees from the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur in 1984, 1986 and 1990 respectively. During 1992-93 and in 2000 he visited the Ruhr-University, Bochum, Germany as a Post-Doctoral Fellow of the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation. He joined the Department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur in 1987 and rose to the rank of Professor in the Higher Academic Grade Pay. He was the Professor In-Charge, Advanced VLSI Design Lab, at IIT Kharagpur during 2004-07. Between 2007 and 2013 he served as the Dean (Alumni Affairs and International Relations) at IIT Kharagpur. Since 2013 he has been serving in a voluntary role of the Executive Advisor, Institutional Development at IIT Kharagpur along with his regular role of a Professor of Electrical Engineering.  Hearty Congratulations to Prof. Patra!!!

IIT Kharagpur has set “Specialty Friction Reducers” in motion  Recently, IIT Kharagpur researchers have contributed towards a new domain of indigenous innovation, “Specialty Friction Reducers” for unconventional oilfields and most significantly, this technique has led to commercialization of this product by an Indian Manufacturer, for the first time, for the global oil and gas industry.  The research scholar, Navneeth Kumar Korlepara along with Prof Sandeep D Kulkarni from Deysarkar Centre of Excellence in Petroleum Engineering, IIT Kharagpur, has worked and contributed extensively on this project as well as Prof Kiran Gore, the Assistant Professor of the Department of Chemistry and his group put invaluable inputs into this project. This research work was mainly sponsored by Dr. Asoke Deysarkar, Chairman of PfP Industries, USA who is also an eminent IIT Kharagpur alumnus. The automatic flow loop built by the team for drag reduction evaluation is first of its kind in the country and it was showcased at National Conference on Upstream Petroleum Engineering 2019 held in IIT Guwahati.  Several journal publications in this domain are underway.  For more information click on the link: https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-has-set-specialty-friction-reducers-in-motion/

Amit Roy appointed to Spearhead Newly Launched Global Phosphorus Institute  Kudos to one of the IIT Kharagpur Distinguished Alumni, Dr Amit Roy, a 1970 graduate, for his selection as the Executive Director of the newly launched Global Phosphorus Institute, because he possess immense experience and knowledge about phosphorus. This world institute will undertake and facilitate research to develop sustainable phosphorus management strategies to ensure its availability for the present and future generations.

Prof Pratihar’s BONOBO OPTIMIZER for several problem solution   Prof. Dilip Kumar Pratihar along with his student, Mr. Amit Kumar Das from the Department of Mechanical Engineering of IIT Kharagpur have proposed a novel metaheuristic optimization algorithm, namely “BONOBO OPTIMIZER (BO)” to solve the complex optimization problems as well as a variety of problems related to Engineering Science, General Science, Arts efficiently, being inspired from the social behavior and reproductive strategies of bonobos. In fact, the optimization tool has been registered for copyright protection.

You care for us, now let us take care of you   On June 19, 2021, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur had come forward to provide ration packets to 2000 Covid Lockdown affected poor people in and around the campus, with the generous contributions of $1 million received from its alumni.   Besides being thankful to the alma mater for such an orderly management of the Covid-19 support program, the president of IIT Kharagpur Foundation USA, Ron Gupta mentioned, “The IIT Kharagpur Foundation alumni are indebted to you all for distribution of the needed supplies to our workers who help the students during their stay. We urge to continue with this program periodically, as needed. The Foundation will continue to support as necessary”.  “We will continue to support the lockdown affected jobless and needy people as long as the impact of COVID- 19 pandemic lasts”, added Prof Virendra Kumar Tewari, the Director of IIT Kharagpur.  To get to know more, please visit the video links given below. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1U2RY7v14Er2K4Mi2zUg_P6a0aZWUE9XM/view?usp=sharing https://drive.google.com/file/d/1LaBJ3GmFir4GZNuxqUEmPsOhIqoqbEY5/view?usp=sharing

It is our great pleasure to share that Centre of Excellence in Advanced Manufacturing Technology, IIT Kharagpur has successfully conducted 14 webinars of “Saturday Manufacturing Talks” so far. This year-long mega event is being conducted under the aegis of “Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav”- a celebration to commemorate the completion of 75 years of India’s independence. Impactful lectures have been held on different aspects of Manufacturing such as Industry 4.0, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning in Manufacturing, Additive Manufacturing, Industry-Academia collaboration, Manufacturing based Start-ups in India, and many more, by the leading academician and industry professionals across the globe. Centre of Excellence in Safety Engineering and Analytics (CoE-SEA), IIT Kharagpur has been organizing the “Weekend Talk on Safety Engineering, Management and Analytics (SEMA)” every Friday from 8 PM to 9 PM (IST). The 2nd weekend talk was held on June 11, 2021 at virtual platform, WEBEX from 8.00 PM to 9.00 PM (IST). Around 260 participants across the world including industry, academic and other organizations joined the event. Prof. J Maiti, Chairman, CoE-SEA, IIT Kharagpur, welcomed the expert speaker Prof George Boustras, Editor in Chief, Safety Science and Director, CERIDES, European University of Cyprus. Prof. George Boustras delivered his expert talk on “Upcoming Challenges in Safety Science and Engineering”. He discussed the two parallel monologues: Safety and security. He also discussed about the challenges in occupational safety and health, several global challenges, cyber security, cyber-attacks and societal safety. Then, the participants interacted with the speaker and provided excellent feedback. Finally, speaking on the occasion as the convener of the function, Prof. O B Krishna appreciated Prof George Boustras for his excellence talk and thanked all the participants for joining the event.

Savoury Nomination for Dr. SANJIV GOENKA for the 5th time as IIT Kharagpur Chairman   Dr. Sanjiv Goenka has once again been nominated as the Chairperson of the Board of Governors of the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur by the Honourable President of India. This will be for a period of one year from 27.06.2021 to 26.06.22.  This is the fifth time Dr. Goenka has been bestowed this honour.  "It is a real honour and a privilege to be able to serve an iconic institution like the Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur,'' said Dr. Sanjiv Goenka, Chairman RP Sanjiv Goenka Group.  " The whole Institute is delighted to get Dr Goenka's guidance and direction for the next one year and take this Institute to higher grounds of excellence ", said Prof V K Tewari, Director of IIT Kharagpur.

Professor Kailash B L Srivastava to be an Associate Editor  Professor Kailash Bihari Lal Srivastava from the Department of Humanities and Social Sciences of IIT Kharagpur has been appointed as an Associate Editor of the Scopus indexed journal "Psychological Studies", published by Springer, for the period of 2021-2024.  Heartiest congratulations to Prof. Srivastava!

Technology Students’ Gymkhana successfully conducted Motivational Talk Show   Technology Students’ Gymkhana at IIT Kharagpur had organized a Motivational Talk Show with Hitesh Sharma, the International Football Player as well as the current player of Hyderabad FC in Indian Super League. More than 45 students including NSO Football players and Inter IIT Football Team players joined the event.  The guest speakers of the event are Prof. Somesh Kumar, the Dean of Students’ Affairs as well as Prof. Ajay Kumar Singh and Dr. Sushant K. Panda, the President and the Senior Sports Officer of Technology Students’ Gymkhana respectively. Mrs. Priyanka Singh, the Sports Officer of Technology Students’ Gymkhana had taken an active role in conducting the event.  The event was commenced with the warm speech by Prof Somesh Kumar. He highlighted that IIT Kharagpur had bagged Gold Medal in the Inter IIT Sports Meet 2019. This was followed by an inspirational speech by Prof. Singh and Dr. Panda.  After this, the keynote speech was given by Mr. Hitesh Sharma. He mentioned about various incidents, the ups and downs in his life. He emphasized on the influence of yoga in relieving stress during big matches and maintaining a healthy mental state of mind. In addition, he demonstrated about making use of GPS technologies, helping football players in regulating their body levels and designing an efficient fitness plan. The session was ended with an interactive question and answer series, followed by thank you notes from Prof Somesh Kumar. Please watch the video:  https://drive.google.com/file/d/17FOufuI23n_4B9ucJ7EdxZszGsJvUe_l/view?usp=sharing]

Intern Hiring Startup ‘Cuvette Tech’ raised $180, 000 in seed funding round   Intern hiring startup, Cuvette Tech, founded by Atul Singhal (2020 graduate, Electrical Department, IIT KGP) and Sudhanshu Singh (2019 graduate, Electrical Department, IIT KGP) has raised $180, 000 in a seed round of funding. The investment is led by Titan Capital, Varun Alagh, co-founder and chief executive officer, Mamaearth; Harish Daiya, co-founder Lumenci and other marquee angel investors. The Bengaluru based startup, Cuvette Tech (https://cuvette.tech/) is a platform to connect student software developers with companies on a full- time and part-time internship basis. Atul & Sudhanshu started their company right from their dorm room at RK Hall (Radha Krishnan Hall of Residence, IIT KGP).  Within 10 months of its inception, Cuvette Tech has managed to engage more than 600 companies from India, Singapore, Dubai and the USA. It has students from more than 150 engineering colleges pan India.

Prof Dewashish Upadhyay to be an Associate Editor  The European Mineralogical Union has invited Professor Dewashish Upadhyay, the Associate Professor of the Department of Geology and Geophysics at IIT Kharagpur, to join the prestigious editorial board of European Journal of Mineralogy (An international journal on mineralogy, petrology, geochemistry, and related sciences), as an Associate Editor.  Heartiest congratulations to Prof Upadhyay!

Prof Parthasarathi Ghosh makes it to the Advisory Board  Prof. Parthasarathi Ghosh from Cryogenic Engineering Centre of IIT Kharagpur has been invited to serve as a member of the Advisory Board of Editors of the prestigious Cryogenics journal.  Heartiest congratulations to Prof. Ghosh!

Shreyashi gets selected to join one week FRIAS summer school programme  The student of Professor Jenia Mukherjee and Professor Anuradha, Shreyashi Bhattacharya from Rekhi Centre of Excellence for the Science of Happiness of IIT Kharagpur, has been selected to join one week (June 28- July 2, 2021) summer school programme on resilience at Freiburg Institute for Advanced Studies (FRIAS), situated at University of Freiburg, for her huge contributions in the field of resilience studies, based on her research article titled, “Many Meanings of Resilience”.  FRIAS Research Focus “Environmental Humanities” 2020/21 is organizing this event exploring the theme “Concepts, Discourses and Practices of Resilience in the Environmental Humanities”, with the aim of providing an open and supportive space to young scholars and advanced students from the Environmental Humanities to critically examine and discuss different perspectives on resilience that will serve as an analytical frame for examining environmental threats and socio-cultural change.  Heartiest congratulations to Ms. Bhattacharya!

Centre of Excellence in Advanced Manufacturing Technology (CoEAMT) at IIT Kharagpur has conducted the 14th webinar of “Saturday Manufacturing Talks” on 12th  June 2021. The session was commenced with an introductory remarks by Prof Surjya K Pal, Chairperson, CoEAMT. Director of IIT Kharagpur, Prof V K Tewari has stressed on the importance of the event to the audience with his insightful speech on the “Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav – a celebration to commemorate completion of 75 years of India’s Independence”. He has also welcomed the small and medium industries and start-ups for collaborative works utilizing the state-of-the art facilities of this Centre. Mr. Bhaskar Majumdar, Founder and Managing Partner of Unicorn India Ventures has delivered an excellent lecture at this webinar on “How to create successful manufacturing based start-ups in India?”. His presentation on the evolution of manufacturing based start-ups in India, current scenario and the need of a strong eco-system was very interesting. At the end of the talk, the attendees shared queries, opinions and suggestions about the upbringing of growing start-ups and their sustainability. This weekly mega webinar series, started on March 13 2021, has been made open to all interested participants across the globe since its inception. All the webinars are being recorded

IIT Kharagpur Researchers’ Novel technique could help in detecting tropical cyclones for Bay of Bengal Basin earlier than satellites  IIT Kharagpur research team led by Prof Prasad K. Bhaskaran along with his students Jiya Albet and Bishnupriya Sahoo from the Department of Ocean Engineering and Naval Architecture, with support from the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India under the Climate Change Programme, devised a novel technique to detect the development or reinforcement of tropical cyclones in the atmospheric column earlier, prior to the satellite detection over the ocean surface in North India Ocean region, using Eddy detection technique.   Their research work has been published by Ministry of Science and Technology, Government of India in the Press Information Bureau as well as it has been published in the journal ‘Atmospheric Research’ recently.  For more information, please visit https://pib.gov.in/PressReleasePage.aspx?PRID=1725487

Weekend Talk with Andrew Page  @CoE-SEA, IIT Kharagpur   On June 04, 2021, Centre of Excellence in Safety Engineering and Analytics (CoE-SEA), the new Centre started by IIT Kharagpur, under Institute of Eminence (IOE) initiatives, had successfully conducted weekend talk on “Safety Engineering, Management and Analytics (SEMA)” - its first event of inaugural and technical, with the aim of disseminating the gamut of knowledge, information and good practices in SEMA to the stakeholders so that they could implement the latest analytics-based safety management systems in the workplaces, an initiative urgently required to improve the flattened safety performance curve across the world.   Around 300 participants across the world including industry, academic and other organizations joined the event. It would be organized every Friday from 08:00 pm – 09:00 pm, on digital platform.     The talk was started with Prof. J Maiti, the Chairman of CoE-SEA followed by the Guest of Honor, Mr. Andrew Page, Past Chairman of World Steel Association Health & Safety Committee, Ex-MD of Coated Products/Long Products, Corus, Ex VP, and Corporate SHE Tata Steel, delivered the keynote speech. Prof. V K Tewari, Director, IIT Kharagpur, Patron and Chief Guest of this inaugural event, mentioned about the importance of such Centre at IIT Kharagpur to improve safety from design and carry out the implementation at the industry level by working in safety engineering, management and analytics.

QS World University Rankings 2022: IIT Kharagpur with highest ever leap in terms of rank The London based Quacquarelli Symonds (QS) has released the QS World University Ranking 2022. Featuring 1300 universities across the world, QS World University Ranking has ranked Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur #280 globally. IIT Kharagpur has shown an improvement on its performance from last year, 2021 by 34 places.  The parameters that are taken into consideration for the rankings include academic reputation, employer reputation, citations per faculty, faculty student ratio, international faculty ratio and international students’ ratio. The citations per faculty is the highest indicator for IIT Kharagpur, ranked #67 globally by scoring 88 out of 100. For more information, please visit:  https://www.topuniversities.com/university-rankings/world-university-rankings/2022 https://www.topuniversities.com/ https://www.linkedin.com/company/qs @topuniversities @universityrankings @TopUnis https://www.youtube.com/topuniversities  #QSWorldUniversityRanking2022 #IITKharagpur #citationsperfaculty

Eminent Water Resources Scientist Award 2019 for Prof. Madan Kumar Jha:  Congratulations to Prof.  Madan Kumar Jha of the Department of Agricultural and Food Engineering at IIT Kharagpur, for getting selected for the prestigious “Eminent Water Resources Scientist Award 2019”, for his immense contributions in the field of water resources development and management at national and international level along with making drastic changes towards the prosperity in the water sector as well as contributions towards the society! A new approach for direct visualization of nanoscale waterways in rocks using the Atomic Force Microscope and its consequence on water percolation.  In a recent study, a team of researchers led by Prof Saibal Gupta, Professor of Geology and Geophysics Department and Prof Rabibrata Mukherjee, Professor of Chemical Engineering Department along with the research scholars Ritabrata Dobe and Anuja Das from the Department of Geology & Geophysics and Chemical Engineering respectively, for the first time, have corroborated that systematic changes in grain boundary morphology in quartzite samples metamorphosed at different metamorphic grades can be directly visualized using Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM) which allows comparatively easy, high magnification imaging and precise width measurements. The research has been published in the reputed journal Scientific Reports, published by Nature publishing group.  https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/a-new-approach-for-direct-visualization-of-nanoscale-waterways-in-rocks-using-the-atomic-force-microscope-and-its-consequence-on-water-percolation/

The Beauty of Graphene nanoplatelets improving Tyre Performance properties.  A recent study has investigated the effect of nanofillers on air impermeability properties of Brominated isobutylene-isoprene rubber (BIIR)/ Epoxidized natural rubber (ENR) blend for automotive applications. A team of researchers led by Prof Kinsuk Naskar from Rubber Technology Centre at IIT Kharagpur along with his student, Ms. Aswathy T R and the collaborator, Mr. Sujith Nair, the vice president of R&D, CEAT Tyre Limited have developed rubber nanocomposites by blending BIIR with ENR 25 and ENR 50 (25% and 50% epoxidation) at the optimized weight proportion, and thereafter different levels of carbon black have been replaced by graphene nanoparticles (GNP). Melt mixing method has been adopted to prepare the composites. The paper has been published by Willey, a publishing company (DOI: 10.1002/pat.4958).  https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/the-beauty-of-graphene-nanoplatelets-improving-tyre-performance-properties/

With a heart that is weighed down with grief and sadness, we announce the passing away of Dr Srikumar Banerjee, the former Chairman of Board of Governors at IIT Kharagpur on 23rd May, 2021 due to a heart attack. The deceased person was at his residence in Navi Mumbai, after recovering from Covid- 19 in the previous month.  He was known as a great physical metallurgist. He retired as the Chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission of India (AECI) and the Secretary of the Department of Atomic Energy (DAE). Prior to this, he served as the Chairman of the Bhabha Atomic Research Centre, Mumbai for six years.  Dr Banerjee earned his B.Tech degree in Metallurgy as well as his Ph.D. from IIT Kharagpur. He was also a recipient of many awards, including Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Award and Padma Shri.  We express our sincere condolences to his family. May God bless and comfort his family during this time of grief. May Dr Banerjee’s soul be at peace. He will always be remembered in our thoughts and prayers.

Our most heartfelt condolences on the sad and sudden demise of Professor Kasturi Lal Chopra, the former Director of IIT Kharagpur (1987-1997). He left us for his heavenly abode on 19th May 2021. He was 87 years old and was widely acknowledged as an excellent academician and an able educational administrator.  He was the recipient of Padmashri Award, Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Award, Indian National Science Academy (INSA) P C Mahalanobis Medal, INSA Aryabhatta Medal, University Grants Commission (UGC) Bhabha Award and much other recognition.  We pray for Eternal Peace to his departed Atman & we also humbly pray to Almighty to provide enough courage & strength to Smt Asha Chopra, all his daughters, other family members and his vast number of admirers to overcome this huge loss and void in their lives.

Shreyashi Bhattacharya, Research Scholar of Rekhi Centre of Excellence for the Science of Happiness has been selected for access to the Huntington Library, California for her work pertaining to the history of the Adi Ganga-Tolly's Nullah.  Shreyashi’s application was selected from a large and competitive pool of applications by the Residential Institute in the History of Science and Technology, California.  The Huntington Research Institute programme, aims to explore the historical roots of humanity’s ongoing transformation of the world’s landscapes, focusing on the anthroforming of Asia, in the context of global concerns on environmental sustainability.  She will be working on the history of the Adi Ganga-Tolly's Nullah under their specific programme of Anthroforming the Landscape: A Historical View from Asia and develop a network with a pool of environmental historians around the world.  Presently, Shreyashi is doing her PhD under the supervision of Dr Jenia Mukherjee and Dr Anuradha Choudry.  Hearty congratulations to Ms. Bhattacharya.

IIT Kharagpur and The University of Edinburgh, UK have launched a virtual student mobility programme to gain insights on water-energy-food-public health from diverse perspectives and analysis of the same with a transdisciplinary approach. The programme would facilitate capacity building and gainful research toward inclusive and sustainable development. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/virtual-student-mobility-programme-with-u-of-edinburgh-for-transdisciplinary-insights-on-rd-topics/ The proposed virtual programme focuses on developing domain knowledge of the participants, particularly in the Indian context, integrating ideas and expertise through group activities on the thematic areas. Under this programme and identifying the issues, the participants will work under the mentorship of faculty members IIT Kharagpur and the University of Edinburgh, before opting for a possible physical mobility programme.   Around 20 students from IIT Kharagpur and 20 students from The University of Edinburgh will participate in this programme over a period of five days during 24-28 May 2021. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/virtual-student-mobility-programme-with-u-of-edinburgh-for-transdisciplinary-insights-on-rd-topics/

IIT Kharagpur has successfully commercialized its flagship healthcare product – COVIRAP – the novel diagnostic technology for infectious diseases including COVID-19 and beyond. The product developed by lead researchers Professor Suman Chakraborty, Dr. Arindam Mondal and their research group has been licensed for commercialization to the Rapid Diagnostic Group of Companies, India and Bramerton Holdings LLC, USA. Here is an explanatory video on COVIRAP https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZkZXzuaIeoQ Know more about the device: https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/global-launch-of-covirap-nucleic-acid-based-point-of-care-diagnostic-device-by-iit-kharagpur-for-covid-19-and-beyond/

Global Launch of COVIRAP – Nucleic acid-based Point-of-Care Diagnostic Device by IIT Kharagpur for COVID-19 and beyond. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/global-launch-of-covirap-nucleic-acid-based-point-of-care-diagnostic-device-by-iit-kharagpur-for-covid-19-and-beyond/ The product developed by lead researchers Professor Suman Chakraborty, Dr. Arindam Mondal and their research group has been licensed for commercialization to the Rapid Diagnostic Group of Companies, India and Bramerton Holdings LLC, USA.  https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/global-launch-of-covirap-nucleic-acid-based-point-of-care-diagnostic-device-by-iit-kharagpur-for-covid-19-and-beyond/  Key Features of this novel technology: - A generic step-wise isothermal nucleic acid-based testing technology for the rapid diagnostics of pathogenic infections including but not limited to SARS-CoV-2 in individuals.  - Nasal Swab/ Saliva to result from integration in about 45 minutes in a highly affordable pre-programmable portable device developed by the team, without requiring any separate facility for RNA extraction.  - Kit supplemented with a free smartphone app to facilitate unambiguous results interpretation and automated dissemination to the patients. The test may be performed by unskilled personnel outside the controlled lab with no intermediate manual intervention between sample loading and result dissemination.  Patents filed in the India, USA, several other countries, and the foreign filing license has been granted recently. The unique trade-off between the high scientific standards of advanced molecular diagnostics with the elegance of common rapid tests for underserved community care. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/global-launch-of-covirap-nucleic-acid-based-point-of-care-diagnostic-device-by-iit-kharagpur-for-covid-19-and-beyond/  #covidupdate #covidresearch #COVID19 #covid #SARSCoV2 #covidtesting #covidtest #diagnostic

InfinityBox, an IIT Kharagpur students startup, has received the seed capital award of $100K by the Hult Prize Foundation.  It is the only Indian company that received the seed capital award of USD 100,000 by the Hult Prize Foundation and alumni of Nexus Incubator by the U.S. Embassy India and Singapore Government-funded Young Social Entrepreneurs 2020.  InfinityBox is working towards reducing the use of less single-use plastics in the food delivery industry. The startup has partnered with two of India’s most prominent food delivery companies, Swiggy in the B2C domain, and HungerBox in the B2B domain, to support them towards sustainable operations.  The startup was also adjudged the national winners at the Innovate 4 SDGs contest by United Nations Development Programme - UNDP Accelerator Labs India [UNDP in India] that included $5000 as a cash prize.  Founding Team: Shashwat Gangwal (IIT KGP 2019), Soham Chandorkar (IIT KGP 2020), Keshav Godala (IIT KGP - 4th Year) and Shiv Kumar (BITS Pilani)  For more information visit https://www.infinityboxkgp.com/  https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-students-startup-infinitybox-awarded-hult-prize-seed-funding/

Research Scholar Jyotsana Priyadarshani, talks about her work titled “Transport of vascular endothelial growth factor dictates on-chip angiogenesis in tumor microenvironment” published in Physics of Fluids journal [Cite as: Phys. Fluids 33, 031910 (2021); https://doi.org/10.1063/5.0042487].  Jyotsana is currently pursuing her PhD in the area of “organ-on-a-chip” at the School of Medical Science & Technology, IIT Kharagpur, under the supervision of Prof Soumen Das & Prof Suman Chakraborty.  Her research focuses on utilizing the frugal fabrication technique and microfluidic applications to address the important features and geometrical complexities of microvasculature in vitro. Such bioengineered microfluidic platforms are potentially suitable for probing cellular dynamics as well as offering critical insights into cancer, cardiovascular diseases, offsetting the requirements of in vivo trials on animals and humans to a large extent.   https://biopatrika.com/2021/04/16/interview-biomimetic-organ-chip-drug-screening/

IIT Kharagpur completes the first year of Alumni-funded relief campaign for pandemic-affected temporary workers https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/first-anniversary-of-alumni-funded-relief-campaign-for-pandemic-affected-temporary-workers/ - Inspired by distinguished alumnus and philanthropist Dr. Vinod Gupta, IIT Kharagpur Foundation USA launched the fundraising campaign from alumni in USA, India and rest of the world in April 2020 and it is ongoing.   - IIT Kharagpur has been organizing regular camps for the distribution of relief materials funded by the alumni benefitting over a half a lakh people  - Temporary workers (including laundry cleaners, domestic helps, temporary hostel workers, rickshaw pullers etc.) and other economically affected poor people who are dependent on the IIT Kharagpur campus for their livelihood were provided relief materials   - The next phase of distribution is scheduled in May.   Talking about the campaign Ron Gupta, President, IIT Kharagpur Foundation USA, said, “We felt particularly concerned about the non-salaried people living around the IIT Kharagpur campus. At the IIT Kharagpur Foundation USA, we raised about five hundred thousand dollars to help more than ten thousand workers with food supplies and even cash in some instances so that they could survive the pandemic. We truly appreciate the leadership at IIT Kharagpur. We Kgpians are what we are due to IIT Kharagpur and these workers like ward boys, rickshaw pullers played a very important role during our education." https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/first-anniversary-of-alumni-funded-relief-campaign-for-pandemic-affected-temporary-workers/

SARS-CoV-2 Alters Lung Cell Metabolism – IIT Kharagpur Research Model Shows, Model Could Help Therapeutics https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-researchers-develop-model-to-find-alteration-in-metabolism-of-lung-cells-affected-by-sars-cov-2/  Coronaviruses are known to hijack the metabolism of lung cells. This threat makes it absolutely imperative to understand the mechanism of metabolic reprogramming of host human cells by SARS-CoV-2.  Researchers at IIT Kharagpur have, for the first time, reported a method to find an alteration in metabolic reaction rates inside lung cells when they are affected by virus/pathogens. As the method finds and reports critical aspects of Physiology, which are affected by SARS-CoV-2 infection, it will enable the discovery of therapeutic targets.  The research was conducted by Dr. Amit Ghosh, Assistant Professor, School of Energy Science & Engineering, IIT Kharagpur, and Piyush Nanda, B.Tech.-M.Tech Dual Degree, Biotechnology, 2020, currently a graduate student at Harvard University.  They have further identified pathways like fatty acid synthesis and lipid metabolism that can be targeted by novel drugs. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-researchers-develop-model-to-find-alteration-in-metabolism-of-lung-cells-affected-by-sars-cov-2/  The research was published in the international journal 'PLOS Computational Biology'.  Cite paper: Article Source: Genome Scale-Differential Flux Analysis reveals deregulation of lung cell metabolism on SARS-CoV-2 infection Nanda P, Ghosh A (2021) Genome Scale-Differential Flux Analysis reveals deregulation of lung cell metabolism on SARS-CoV-2 infection. PLOS Computational Biology 17(4): e1008860. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1008860  #covid19 #coronavirus #metabolism #lungcell #covid #covidresearch #covidupdate #CoronaVirusUpdate #Coronavirusresearch #genomics #therapeutic #covidtherapy #coviddrug

Betel leaf (Paan) is known for its health benefits [digestion, stimulation of senses and fresh breath], essentially due to the presence of antimicrobial and antioxidant-rich essential oil. - IIT Kharagpur has developed an essential oil extractor to make the extraction process of this essential oil economically viable. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpurs-develop-essential-oil-extractor-to-economize-betel-leaf-production-in-india/ - The extractor is capable of saving 44% of the time and 30% of the energy requirement while increasing the oil yield by more than 16%, as compared to the current process and apparatus popularly used. -India produces betel leaves worth ₹ 9000 million per year grossing as the largest producer of betel leaf in the world. However, achieving profitability remains a crucial challenge as a minimum of 10% of the produce is wasted every year and a large portion remains unsold or sold at throwaway prices during the glut season. -This extractor equipment is expected to check such wastage and channel the surplus for various industrial products. -Further, the equipment can extract essential oil from other organic materials as well. -It has been patented and transferred to more than 20 government and private bodies and more are underway. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpurs-develop-essential-oil-extractor-to-economize-betel-leaf-production-in-india/

Law students at IIT Kharagpur are drafting #patents for Institute’s innovations. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-law-students-to-draft-real-time-patents-for-institutes-innovations/  Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law, IIT Kharagpur introduces training of LLB students in real-time patent drafting for high-end innovations by researchers at the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur leveraging the technological ecosystem for IP law education. In the Spring semester, the students directly interacted with the Institute's inventors, who are working on high-end technologies. They studied invention disclosure and preparing the #patent application with the claims in line with the statutory requirements under #patentlaw and the examination practice. The exercise was facilitated by the #IPR Cell of IIT Kharagpur. The drafted claims and patent specifications were evaluated by the #patentattorney of the Institute while providing the students important insights into the drafting of patent specifications and claims including the cross-jurisdiction practice. In 2006 IIT Kharagpur had introduced a new academic discipline in the IIT system – Intellectual Property Law, and RGSOIPL has emerged as one of India’s top law schools. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-law-students-to-draft-real-time-patents-for-institutes-innovations/

The Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software developed and extensively used by IIT Kharagpur for institutional use, is now to be adopted by IIT Ropar and IIT Jodhpur.   IIT Kharagpur has signed MoU with both the IITs for customization, installation and deployment of the ERP system. The modules covered in the commercial version of the software include Academics (including new Admissions), Career Development, Accounts, Human Resources, Purchase, Hall Management Centre, Continuing Education, Guest House and also Institute Works. The modules are menu-driven with role-based access and delegation facility, rule engine-based approval process and data-oriented based process definition. Necessary end-user customization, training of staff to support operation and further customization and the user end is included within the scope of the MoU. We are enthused with the positive reception to our ERP by IIT Ropar and IIT Jodhpur. IIT Kharagpur has also been approached by other institutions for similar adoption of its indigenously ERP.  For more information visit: https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/erp-software-developed-by-iit-kharagpur-adopted-by-other-iits/

Dr. Debasish Datta, Former Professor (retired), Dept. of Electronics & Electrical Communication Engineering, IIT Kharagpur has authored the book 'Optical Networks' which has been recently published by Oxford University Press, UK. The book captures his 35+ years of teaching and research in the area of optical communications and networking.  The subject Optical Networks (named as Lightwave Networks in the E&ECE curriculum of IIT Kharagpur) was introduced for the first time in India in the late 80s, though research in this area started from the early 1980's. This book presents the whole subject with a natural flow from optical networks overview and technologies (Part I), to first-generation optical networks using single-wavelength transmission (Part II), next-generation WDM networks (Part III), and some selected contemporary as well as emerging topics on optical networks (Part IV). It further gives a pedagogical presentation of underlying concepts and analytical models, with minimal reference to background material. It also includes first-generation optical networks and several contemporary and emerging topics. The three appendices in the book present fundamental mathematical tools in a lucid manner: linear programming, optical receiver noise processes and queuing theory.

IIT Kharagpur's Ozone and Ultra-filter-based manufacturing process technology to extend shelf life of packaged Sugarcane juice without heat or chemical. Research scholar Chirasmita Panigrahi from the Dept. of Agricultural & Food Engineering who worked on developing this technology under the guidance of Prof. H N Mishra of the Agricultural & Food Engineering Department and co-guidance Prof. Sirshendu De of the Chemical Engineering Department has been selected for the NRDC National Meritorious Invention Awards 2020 by the National Research Development Corporation, Government of India. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/home/education/news/iit-kharagpurs-ozone-and-ultra-filter-based-manufacturing-tech-to-extend-shelf-life-of-packaged-sugarcane-juice-without-heat-and-chemicals/articleshow/81718186.cms

Centre of Excellence in Advanced Manufacturing Technology, IIT Kharagpur invites you to the third webinar of "Saturday Manufacturing Talks"  Topic "Design of Experiments in Engineering and Science" Speaker: Professor Tapan P Bagchi Date & Time: March 27, 2021, 0830 - 0930 PM IST WEBINAR LINK: https://iitkharagpur.webex.com/iitkharagpur/j.php?MTID=m00ba321c9f62cf6aeb29a33edab1b210  The topics of the weekly webinar series include but not limited to Robotics, Automation, and Use of AI and ML in manufacturing, - Simulation in manufacturing, Specialty materials in manufacturing, Additive manufacturing, AI in Supply Chain, Design of Experiments in engineering  The webinar series will host IIT Kharagpur alumni in industry and academia as speakers who will give an understanding of the research being conducted globally on advanced manufacturing.

Chirasmita Panigrahi, research scholar at the Dept. of Agricultural & Food Engineering, IIT Kharagpur has been selected for the NRDC National Meritorious Invention Awards 2020 by the National Research Development Corporation, Government of India, for developing a novel process technology to extend the shelf life of packaged Sugarcane juice.  https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-develops-new-manufacturing-tech-for-fruit-juice/  Supervised by Professor H N Mishra of the Agricultural & Food Engineering Department and co-supervised Professor Sirshendu De of the Chemical Engineering Department, the new technology involves ultra-filtering and ozonization of the freshly extracted microfiltered juice followed by packaging under an aseptic environment. The combined membrane filtration and ozone treatment technology resulted in 7 log reduction in bacteria, 5 log reduction in yeasts & moulds and 85% inactivation of enzyme polyphenol oxidase, without heat or chemical.  https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-develops-new-manufacturing-tech-for-fruit-juice/ According to the researchers, this could minimize the juice fermentation and brown to a greater extent during storage. The combined technology treated juice could be successfully stored up to 12 weeks under refrigeration without any appreciable change in its bioactive and essential nutrients. The treated juice well retained its sensory characteristics especially the colour and flavour during storage. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-develops-new-manufacturing-tech-for-fruit-juice/

Researchers at IIT Kharagpur are making #Sanskrit accessible with their #ArtificialIntelligence-based system for processing Sanskrit texts. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/making-sanskrit-accessible-through-ai-based-text-processing/ The researchers have developed a digital infrastructure for Sanskrit text processing by combining machine learning techniques and traditional linguistic knowledge from Sanskrit. The proposed framework enables the encoding of relevant linguistic information as constraints. The proposed framework substantially reduces the training data requirements to as low as 10%, as compared to that of the neural state-of-the-art models. The team working to extend the application of the proposed system for automatic speech recognition and Q&A in Sanskrit. The proposed AI-based system, used in conjunction with interactive tools such as Sanskrit Heritage reader, can aid users in the easier analysis of manuscripts with word-by-word analysis & translation, the relation between words, poetry to prose conversion, search and answering questions. Refer to the original article titled "A Graph-Based Framework for Structured Prediction Tasks in Sanskrit"[https://doi.org/10.1162/coli_a_00390] https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/making-sanskrit-accessible-through-ai-based-text-processing/

A team of four undergraduate students from the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur emerged as winners at the CoreNet Global Academic Challenge 6.0, sponsored by Cushman and Wakefield, KI and IA: Interior Architects. The team comprised of Siddhant Samarth (Third Year Undergraduate, Department of Civil Engineering), Pratim Majumdar (Third Year Undergraduate, Department of Chemical Engineering), Rishita Raj (Second Year Undergraduate, Department of Mechanical Engineering) and Utkarsh Agrawal (Third Year Undergraduate, Department of Manufacturing Science and Engineering), and were guided by Prof. Jenia Mukherjee (Department of Humanities and Social Sciences). The team from IIT Kharagpur was one of the four teams to progress into the final round out of 1300 teams all over the world and were pitted against the University of Washington, New York University and the University of Denver in the final round hosted online on 18th March 2021. This is the first time that a squad from India has emerged as winners in the CoreNet Global Academic Challenge since the inception of the competition in 2015.  The team from IIT Kharagpur worked on a hypothetical case on developing an environmentally resilient Corporate Real Estate Portfolio while gauging the impact of the pandemic, for Blue Banc, a fictitious financial institution based in London, England. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-wins-the-corenet-global-academic-challenge-6-0/

Dr. Deshpande works at the interface of chemistry, biology, materials science and chemical engineering taking advantage of the concepts from the different disciplines for handling interesting scientific problems. Researchers and students from an environment-focused group at the Dept. of Civil Engineering, IIT Kharagpur participated in a transboundary expedition Sea to Source: Ganges” organized by the National Geographic Society to scientifically document plastic waste in the Ganges watershed and support holistic and inclusive solutions.  https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/studying-plastic-pollution-in-the-ganga-with-national-geographic/ Talking about their role in the study-based expedition, Prof. Brajesh Dubey who heads this group at IIT Kharagpur said, “We carried out the waste characterization from the city/town dumpsite waste samples, as well as the samples collected along the river from Rishikesh to Howrah. It helped in estimating the extent of mismanaged plastics in the waste, the type of plastics present in the waste and the estimation of the fraction of mismanaged waste plastics getting into the river Ganga. A model is also being developed using the field data to have a realistic estimation of the plastic pollution transport from land to river and eventually to the ocean.” The IIT research group also performed a photographic survey of waste management practices and issues for each city/town. Further, they held and discussions with city officials on waste management plans, identification of infrastructure gaps for the city/town and suggestions for improvement in the implementation of the solutions for better plastic waste management.  The solutions proposed include the proper waste collection in segregation mode, capacity building in terms of infrastructure development as well as skill improvement of manpower involved in waste management practices at ULB levels.  The research group is in touch with several ULBs for the improvement of their waste management infrastructure.  Isabela Foundation, University of Dhaka, the Wildlife Institute of India, and Wild Team Bangladesh were also project partners. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/studying-plastic-pollution-in-the-ganga-with-national-geographic/ Photo courtesy: Sara Hylton

Mohamed Faizal Ussama J., working as an MS student in Materials Science Center, under the supervision of Dr. Shibayan Roy, has recently secured 3rd prize for the group project titled "Write an article to Wikipedia on the use of glass in the human body" at the 2nd ICG-CGCRI Tutorial 2021.  Hearty Congratulations!  Total three prizes were awarded to project groups after evaluation of the project presentations by the jury members. Out of which, the team comprising Mr. Mohamed Faizal Ussama J from IIT Kharagpur, Shakthi Prasad and Anustup Chakraborty from CGCRI, Ankit Gurjar from IIT Bombay, Manmeet Chhina from Thapar Institute, Sambit Ray from NIT Rourkela has won the third prize for presenting the project work assigned to us titled “Write an article for Wikipedia on the use of glass in the human body”.   Their project was to analyze the problem statement and present them in a way understandable to a general audience. The project was to collect technical information required to write a Wikipedia article and to present them as a whole in a single article/ presentation, which will help both common audience and experts gain an overall insight, highlighting the various types, forms, functions, advantages of glasses over other materials, and how they can be used for various treatments in our human body.  ICG-CGCRI Tutorial on Glass occurs once in 4 years, was jointly organized by The International Commission on Glass (ICG) and CSIR-Central Glass & Ceramic Research Institute (CSIR-CGCRI).

On 6th March, Aero-Society, Department of Aerospace Engineering hosted a guest talk with Dr. Pratyush Kumar Vice President of Boeing International and Head of the iconic F15 Fighter Aircraft Program. He also interacted with students while addressing challenges and opportunities in the Aerospace industry in India and Worldwide. According to Subir Chowdhury, Global Quality Expert, Distinguished Alumnus Awardee, IIT Kharagpur, “Quality combines people power and process power .  .  . The costs of poor quality are tangible; they will cost you customers and money, and ultimately affect the success of your business." His alma mater IIT Kharagpur has taken up the responsibility to train industry professionals and academicians through courses and training modules to develop the new age quality professionals at the Subir Chowdhury School of Quality and Reliability. In addition to postgraduate degree programs, core courses, electives and microspecializations for students of the Institute, the School has been organizing short-term courses for working professionals both from academic and industry backgrounds. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpurs-unique-school-upgrading-quality-and-reliability-for-indian-industrial-sector/ Along with his organization ASI Consulting Group, the School also organizes international workshops and is gearing up for outreach and awareness programs. The term “Blockchain” has now become a buzzword, and several myths, propagandas, misconceptions, and fairy tales have been around throughout the past ten years concerning this new yet powerful technology. EcoDabba, a startup by young alumni and students of IIT Kharagpur has been adjudged Indian Student Winner at the India Australia Circular Economy (I-ACE) Hackathon. The feat comes in the theme of creating opportunities for plastics waste reduction. EcoDabba presented a novel idea of storing food in bagasse (sugarcane waste) coated with an eco coating for increased longevity which is 100% biodegradable food storage packaging. The solution by Ecodabba quickly biodegrades replenishing the soil and creating value for farmers. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/alumni-startup-wins-india-australia-circular-economy-hackathon/ The event was jointly conducted by Atal Innovation Mission, NITI Aayog and the national science agency of Australia – Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO). The award ceremony of the event was graced (virtually) by Hon’ble PMO India Narendra Modi,  Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison (ScoMo) and CEO of Niti Aayog Amitabh Kant along with numerous Indian and Australian luminaries. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/alumni-startup-wins-india-australia-circular-economy-hackathon/ Almost 80 teams of students and small and medium businesses from India and Australia turned their collective minds to solving the world’s global challenges with a focus on stopping waste and creating sustainable business practices. Four student teams and four SME teams each from Australia and India were awarded across the four themes. Ecodabba was selected among 1000+ submissions. Mentored by the founders of EcoDabba: Bindu Sancheti, Sourav Kundu and Nikita Agrawal, graduates of 2020, the idea was presented by Rajat Maheshwari, Soumya Acharya, and Krishna Kumar Soni. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/alumni-startup-wins-india-australia-circular-economy-hackathon/

Yogshree Chouksee, Sahil Agarwal, Saharsh Pugalia from the Dept. of Humanities and Social Sciences and Prerit Jain from the Dept. of Industrial and Systems Engineering have won the National Final of CFA Institute Research Challenge 2020-2021. They were mentored by Dr. Abhijeet Chandra, faculty at Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur. The team was adjudged winner on the basis of their submission of financial analysis and valuation of a firm. The team has been chosen along with IIM Ahmedabad and IIM Ranchi to represent India in the Asia Regionals of the CFA Institute Research Challenge 2020-2021, to be held in March 2021.   The CFA Institute conducts this research challenge every year and invites nominations from premier b-schools.

Researchers from the Dept. of Mining Engineering led by Prof. Khanindra Pathak have afforested 32000 sqft of hazardous & polluting steel slag dumpsites into greenbelts in the Angul region of Odisha. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/turning-steel-slug-dump-to-greenery-hub-iit-kharagpurs-transformative-work-at-odisha/ The researchers used a unique mix of Panchagavya (traditional organic mix) with Miyawaki plantation technique developed by ecologist Prof. Akira Miyawaki from Japan. The process led an unsupportive steel slag dump to a self-sustaining primary succession of greenery over it fulfilling the mandate of Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change, Government of India while protecting nearby villages from pollution and supporting them through vegetation growth and green cover. The demonstrated methodology also has the possibility to eliminate the need for expensive geotextiles developed in the country using imported technology. A similar approach could be beneficial for urban wastewater management as well as municipality solid waste dump sites. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/turning-steel-slug-dump-to-greenery-hub-iit-kharagpurs-transformative-work-at-odisha/

PM to Inaugurate Dr. Syama Prasad Mookerjee Institute of Medical Sciences and Research at IIT Kharagpur on 23rd February 2021. PM to also address the 66th Convocation of IIT Kharagpur https://pib.gov.in/PressReleseDetail.aspx?PRID=1699809  Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi will inaugurate Dr. Syama Prasad Mookerjee Institute of Medical Sciences and Research at IIT Kharagpur and will address the 66th Convocation of IIT Kharagpur, on 23rd February 2021 at 1230 PM via video conferencing.  Governor of West Bengal, Union Education Minister, and Union Minister of State for Education will also be present on the occasion.  Dr. Syama Prasad Mookerjee Institute of Medical Sciences and Research  The super speciality hospital has been set up by the Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur with support from the Ministry of Education. The institute is inspired by the vision of the Prime Minister that the future of India will be shaped by investment in science and innovation and driven by its research talent. This hospital thus is a product of the fusion between technology and healthcare.  Taking the legacy of IIT Kharagpur in developing health care technology products further, the hospital will focus on robust Biomedical, Clinical and Translational Research, development of remote diagnostics, telemedicine, teleradiology along with research in drug design and delivery. The MBBS programme is expected to start from the academic year 2021-22 in addition to Postgraduate and doctoral programmes.

IIT Kharagpur has collaborated with Gurudev Tagore Indian Cultural Center (GTICC) Indian Council For Cultural Relations, India In Mexico (Embassy of India, Mexico City) and Oraworld Mandala to present a series of online exhibitions and workshop titled “Life on Scroll: Lockdown Creativity” by scroll painters and folk artists from India and Mexico.  Join us for the live event on Saturday, 20th February 2021 at 09.00 PM, IST (09.30 AM CDMX). https://streamyard.com/evwxn4x96i The highlight of this exhibition is a visual representation of #COVID19 of Naya, Amate and Huichol art and interactions among the scroll painters from Naya with the Amate artists and Huichol/Textile painters from Mexico. Book review – Global groundwater: Source, scarcity, sustainability, security, and solutions, co-authored by Prof. Abhijit Mukherjee, Associate Professor, Dept of Geology and Geophysics and School of Environmental Science and Engineering https://gripp.iwmi.org/2021/01/04/book-review-global-groundwater-source-scarcity-sustainability-security-and-solutions/ This book identifies and discusses issues of key thematic and geographic importance. Regional analyses span five continents and 14 countries. It provides reviews of current technologies and introduces the socioeconomic issues that should be considered in conjunction with the technical issues when developing groundwater management plans or addressing unforeseen crises. Prof. Parthasarathi Chakraborty, Associate Professor, Centre for Oceans, Rivers, Atmosphere and Land Sciences (CORAL) has been appointed as an Associate Editor of two journals Frontiers in Marine Science and Frontiers in Environmental Science. Prof. Chakraborty initiated metal speciation study in India to understand the role of metal-natural ligands interactions in controlling distribution, fate, mobility, and bioavailability of trace/toxic metals in marine environments (estuarine, coastal and open ocean). research provides better understanding of one of the closely guarded secrets of nature: how the metal-buffering action of natural ligands (Fe/Mn-oxyhydroxide, dissolved organic carbon, humic substances etc) makes them a vital web in the complex fabric of homeostasis. AI 4 ICPS IIT Kharagpur, the Technology Innovation Hub on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Interdisciplinary Cyber-Physical Systems, set up IIT Kharagpur under the aegis of the National Mission on Interdisciplinary Cyber-Physical Systems (NM-ICPS), Science and Engineering Research Board - SERB, Department of Science and Technology, Government of India, has been named among the Top 8 AI Labs in India in 2021 by the Analytics India Magazine. https://analyticsindiamag.com/top-8-ai-labs-in-india-in-2021/  More info about AI4ICPS http://www.ai4icps.in/

Researchers at IIT Kharagpur have developed energy-efficient pest controlling device for smaller agricultural tracts owned by marginal farmers. The research team consisting of Prof. Hifjur Raheman, Anup Behera Rahul K and Prof. P.B.S. Bhadoria from the Dept. of Agricultural and Food Engineering has developed a self-propelled boom-type sprayer that can be operated using solar energy while safely guided through the crops in smaller tracts of land. The device is aimed to increase field capacity and uniformity in liquid spraying and also to reduce drudgery to the operator and dependency on fossil fuel for carrying out spraying in cropped areas. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-develops-solar-powered-pest-control-system-for-smaller-farmlands/ The majority of Indian farmers are in the small or marginal category with less than 2 hectares of landholding. Their technological needs distinctly vary from larger farms. This calls for technological developments for small farms which is also in line with the mission of Govt. of India to increase farmers' income through technological interventions. The researchers at IIT Kharagpur have been developing such technologies which are in use in various villages in Eastern India, covering almost 20000 farmers. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/iit-kharagpur-develops-solar-powered-pest-control-system-for-smaller-farmlands/

The Deysarkar Center of Excellence in Petroleum Engineering, IIT Kharagpur is organizing one online seminar by Prof. Mrinal K. Sen, Professor, Institute of Geophysics, The University of Texas at Austin, USA on 15 February 2021 at 5:30 pm (IST). The title of the seminar is “An overview of full waveform inversion method and its application”. Join the seminar: https://meet.google.com/kgo-aerm-iyw  Prof. Mrinal K. Sen is Professor in the Department of Geological Sciences, Jackson School of Geosciences and Associate Director in the Institute for Geophysics, Jackson School of Geosciences in the University of Texas at Austin, USA. He is also John A. and Katherine G. Jackson Chair in Applied Seismology and Morgan J. Davis Centennial Chair in Petroleum Geology. Prof. Sen is also Ex-Director of National Geophysical Research Institute, Hyderabad, India.  Prof. Sen is a specialist in seismic wave propagation including anisotropy, inversion and uncertainty quantifications. The proposed seminar will be on Google meet platform with the following link: https://meet.google.com/kgo-aerm-iyw

Dr. Jenia Mukherjee, Assistant Professor at the Department of Humanities and Social Sciences, IIT Kharagpur has published a pioneering volume on Kolkata's ecological history - Blue Infrastructures: Natural History, Political Ecology and Urban Development in Kolkata. In this book, the author focuses on Kolkata, formerly the colonial capital of and currently a major megacity in India, in terms of its extensive blue infrastructures, i.e., its rivers, canals and wetlands as an integrated composite whole. Dr Jenia Mukherjee received the prestigious Carson Writing Fellowship from the Rachel Carson Center for Environment and Society, Munich Germany to complete the book project. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/book-review-blue-infrastructures-natural-history-political-ecology-and-urban-development-in-kolkata/

Technology Students Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur organized an educational webinar on January 29, 2021 in association with Gopali Youth Welfare Society (GYWS), to celebrate the cause of National Girl Child Day.  GYWS is an NGO run by IIT Kharagpur students along with some faculty members with the support of local members from Gopali. Started in 2002, GYWS offers free education, social awareness campaigns, skill development programs and vocational training to better the living standards of people in Gopali village and ensuring a life of dignity. From time to time, programs are conducted through various sections of the Institute to improve the engagement of faculty and students with the Gopali community.  The event witnessed the participation of students from Jagriti Vidya Mandir, a school run by GYWS. The speakers were Prof. Somesh Kumar, Dean Students Affairs, Prof. V R Desai, Dean, Faculty of Engineering and Architecture and Ms. Prinyanka Singh, sports official at Technology Students’ Gymkhana. A quiz competition was also held in association with IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club.

The Agri-Food Techathon (AFT-2021), a national level on-line Startup selection program being organised by the NABARD funded Agri Business Incubation Center (ABIC) of IIT Kharagpur in association with AgFE, CRDIST 7 RMSoEE was inaugurated on 25th January through an online event by the Hon’ble Education Minister, Dr. Ramesh Pokhrial ‘Nishank’ in the gracious presence Dr G R Chintala Chairman NABARD and Prof V K Tewari Director IIT Kharagpur. The AFT-2021 aims to select and support promising early-stage Agri and Food Startup teams for incubation and support in the form of mentoring, consultancy, access to RnD facilities and funding opportunities. The inauguration has set the stage for the participants for the competitive Startup Pitch submission. After screening and first round of submissions, selected teams will be assigned expert mentors as per their domain area, for providing guidance on product and business-plan development. The final presentation will be used to select high potential teams for formal association with ABIC. They will be offered assistance in the form of Technology and Business Development Mentorship, R&D support, Laboratory/Workshop/Pilot-plant access and funding opportunities through potential investors/accelerators. AFT-2021 has a broad scope as far as the stage of applicants is concerned. Teams from three different categories viz. (i) idea level, (ii) under development/stealth mode, (iii) already registered and operational will be selected based on merit.  Applications can be submitted at https://bit.ly/3t3cIAG  The last date for application submission is 10th February 2021.

Prof. Koel Chaudhury and her research group at the School of Medical Science and Technology have extensively used the metabolomics approach to investigate women’s health with an emphasis on pregnancy-related complications. They have tapped into metabolomics to identify disease biomarkers (for example, indicators for early diagnosis of stage 1 endometriosis). They are also working towards unraveling the biological mechanism underlying complex human diseases (such as unexplained recurrent miscarriage and its early prediction).  In this article, Prof. Chaudhury, who has been honoured for her contribution to reproductive health, talks about her core research areas, the challenges, and the updates on her research. She also emphasizes on public engagement with women such as through the use of pamphlets in vernacular to generate awareness. https://fit.thequint.com/her-health/metabolomics-explained-koel-chaudhary-women-reproductive-health  Prof. Koel Chaudhury is a Professor at the School of Medical Science and Technology, IIT Kharagpur. Her expert areas of R&D include Non-invasive biomarkers and sensors, Metabolomics, Nanomedicine, Women's health, Respiratory disorders. More about Prof. Chaudhury: http://www.iitkgp.ac.in/department/MM/faculty/mm-koel

Prof. Srabani Taraphder, Professor, Department of Chemistry, has been elected as a Fellow of West Bengal Academy of Science & Technology (WAST) for the year 2020.  Hearty congratulations to Prof Taraphder!  The research interest of Prof. Srabani Taraphder centers around computer simulation studies of simple charge transfer reactions in complex environments such as enzymes, their mutational variants and functionalized carbon nanotubes. The group has developed and used extensive computational methods of studying proton transfer reactions using a wide range of simulation methods. Their work is aimed at elucidating the structure-function relationship of proteins and nanoscale systems in terms of the overall free energy cost of a reaction catalyzed/supported by these systems.

The National Bank For Agriculture & Rural Development (NABARD) funded Agri Business Incubation Center (ABIC) of IIT Kharagpur is organizing "Agri-Food Techathon" (AFT-2021), a national level on-line technical fest from January to March 2021.  The event aims to publicize ABIC as an attractive platform for Agri-entrepreneurs and help in the selection of high potential, early-stage startup teams for incubation and support in the form of mentoring, consultancy, access to RnD facilities and funding opportunities.                        AFT will be inaugurated on 25th January through an online event by the honourable Education Minister, Shri Ramesh Pokhrial. A panel discussion has been organized by ABIC on this occasion, which will have eminent experts from the agri-tech and agri-business area. The panel will be moderated by Sri Sanjiv Rangrass, former Chief Executive of Agri-Business Division of ITC. Sri Vivek Aggarwal, Joint Secretary, (IT & Crops) & CEO PM KISAN, Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Government of India, Sri Jinesh Shah, Co-founder of Omnivore, one of the most prominent agri-focused venture capital fund in India, Sri Hemendra Mathur, Chairman, Agri Startup Workforce, FICCI and Sri Rishabh Sawansukha, a recognized agri-entrepreneur and investor, will participate in the panel discussion and will share their views on “Agri Food The Startup EcoSystem in India''.   The inaugural event will set the stage for the two months long Agri-Food-Techathon. It will include a competitive B-plan submission for the participants. After screening and the first round of Bplan presentation, selected teams will be assigned expert mentors as per their domain area, for providing guidance on product and business development. The final presentation will be used to select high potential teams for formal association with ABIC. They will be offered assistance in the form of Technology and Business Development Mentorship, R&D support, Laboratory/Workshop/Pilot-plant access and funding opportunities through potential investors/accelerators.   The AFT-2021, will be organized with the support of Agricultural and Food Engineering Department, Centre for Rural Development and Innovative Sustainable Technology (CRDIST) and Rajendra Mishra School of Engineering Entrepreneurship (RMSoEE) at IIT Kharagpur.

Empowering rural unemployed youth, creating indigenous agricultural and food technologies for entrepreneurship, paving the way to #AatmaNirbharBharat - Agri-Food Techathon (AFT) 2021 is the platform to set the course for the research-based agri business startups to be incubated at the Agri Business Incubation Centre (ABIC) at IIT Kharagpur. 125 agrepreneurs will be incubated at ABIC. The foundation stone of the Centre will be laid by Dr.Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank, Hon'ble Shiksha Mantri, Ministry of Education at the inauguration of AFT 2021 on January 25, 2021 at 2.00 PM. Dr. Saptarshi Ghosh, Assistant Professor of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Kharagpur, has been appointed as the Head of a Max Planck Partner Group of the Max Planck Institute for Software Systems (MPI-SWS), Germany.   Max Planck Society and MPI-SWS will sponsor development of the research group to be headed by Dr. Saptarshi Ghosh at IIT Kharagpur for a period of five years. Team  Intelligent Picker from IIT Kharagpur has been awarded the runner up position in the Flipkart Grid 2.0 National Challenge for the design of a novel and versatile gripper-manipulator system. The team comprised of Shivam Kumar Panda, Abhinav Gupta, Siva Vignesh Krishnan, Adarsh Patnaik, Vibhakar Mohta from the Dept. of Mechanical Engineering and was mentored by Dr. Aditya Bandyopadhyay, Assistant Professor, Dept. of Mechanical Engineering.  A lot of manual effort is required today to locate, pick and place items in a warehouse. While there have been many advancements in picking automation in terms of various robotic arms, the industry is still facing unique challenges to locate and pick items of non-uniform shapes and sizes.   A novel and versatile gripper alongwith an inexpensive manipulator has been designed by a team from IIT Kharagpur which can handle a wide range of products in warehouses. The autonomous bot can move around, locate different products, can grasp the required object with its unique grasping mechanism and stow it to the designated area. This would contribute to the autonomous management of logistics in the Industry 4.0 revolution.

With the increasing demand for food and growing thrust on efficient resource management, farmers are adopting the practice of precision farming to achieve higher yields while utilizing inputs precisely, especially in the Indian context of small-farm holdings. The Precision Farming Development Centre (PFDC) at the Dept. of Agricultural and Food Engineering, IIT Kharagpur, has carried out in-depth laboratory and field research experiments, hardware, and software developments on various aspects of micro-irrigation technology. Here are insights from Prof. K N Tiwari. https://kgpchronicle.iitkgp.ac.in/promotion-of-micro-irrigation-installation-for-improving-horticultural-production/

Gourab Bhattacharjee and Joydeep Baral, Ph.D. scholars at the Department of Biotechnology, IIT Kharagpur [carrying out research under the supervision of Prof. Amit Kumar Das and Dr. Amit Ghosh], Bharat Manna from the School of Energy Science and Engineering, IIT Kharagpur and Rajkumar Chakraborty Delhi Technological University, have won the "Innovative Implementable Idea Award" at Covid-Samhar Hackathon, a computational hackathon organized jointly by CDAC-Pune and NVIDIA. Based on a computational study, the team predicted two existing medicines that can be repurposed to treat COVID-19. One of the medicines is currently being tested at ICMR-NIV, Pune.
